DOC.brief_summary: This study will investigate the safety and tolerability of a flexible dosing regimen of asenapine for the long-term treatment of manic or mixed episodes associated with bipolar disorder I in children and adolescents who completed study P06107.
DOC.brief_title: Extension Study of Asenapine [P06107 (NCT01244815)] for Pediatric Bipolar Disorder (P05898)
DOC.criteria: Completed study P06107 and demonstrated acceptable degree of compliance with medication, visits and other study requirements Must be male or a female who is not of childbearing potential and is not sexually active or is using a medically accepted method of contraception; or female who is not pregnant, or not lactating. Must have a caregiver or responsible person living with the participant who agrees to provide support to ensure compliance with treatment, visits, and protocol procedures Positive pregnancy test or intention to become pregnant during the study At imminent risk of selfharm or harm to others Under involuntary inpatient commitment Known serological evidence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibody
